Articles.Content:
KSP Version: v0.25 Windows 32-bit

What Happens: Graphics issues withing the VAB. See pictures.

This is not causing crashes for me, it's simply a visual error which does not go away, whether I exit and re-enter the VAB or not.

Mods / Add-Ons: All Stock, with a fresh install this morning.

Steps to Replicate:

Takes place whenever entering the VAB

Result: See image

Fixes/Workarounds:

None known.

Other Notes/Pictures:

Edited October 8, 2014 by HMS Sophia

I've got the same problem. The game also crashes when switching buildings or pressing the launch button. Furthermore, the program is running noticeably slow. With 0.24 I had no problems at all.

Win 7 32-Bit, 4 GB Ram, GPU: AMD Radeon 3850, CPU: AMD Turion X2 (mobile).

I tried to lower resolution and turn down the graphics quality but the problem is still there.
Please follow the advice in the sticky thread at the top of this sub-forum that explains how to report problems in a useful manner.

Please follow the advice in the sticky thread at the top of this sub-forum that explains how to report problems in a useful manner.

Edited OP to coincide with formatting.

Edited OP to coincide with formatting.

The log(s) it asks for is the most important part...
Sorry, I am to lazy to upload the logfiles. It seems to be a memory related issue. Its working on my computer again by reducing the texture size to half res.

Try this. If your running ksp from steam. Right click ksp in steam library go into properties>local files>verify integrity of cache.

I only have steam so idk what the idea is for store version. Might need a reinstall.

This has happened in previous versions too I think. I think you can solve it by deleting the contents of your GameData directory and verifying the game cache. This will force it to download again. I can't remember for sure, but I think that you might have some corrupted files.

Cheers,

~Claw
